data.title: Land Speed Record
data.meta_description:
Land Speed Record by Square Tugs, released 24 June 2024

1. $2 Taco
2. Screaming At The Wall
3. Gone But Not Forgotten
4. No Shoes, 2 Mobile Phones
5. One Minute Love Song
6. Serenity Now
7. Constant Motion
8. Lockdown
9. Land Speed Record
10. Straight To Hell
11. Fortitude Valley
12. You Made Me Be Someone
13. Tony Was A Friend Of Mine
14. In My Eye
15. I'm Moving On
16. Farewell, Good Riddance And Goodnight
17. Yippy-Yi-Ya Motherfucker

2nd album from Brisbane band Square Tugs
data.text:
1.

$2 Taco 01:38

I saw you at a dive bar I knew I had to meet ya I drank a case of Corona And then I walked right up to greet ya I said Hey my name is Mark And you have got my heart I said my dad was Mexican So, we drank tequila special blend I said Hey my name is Mark But you can call me Marko Before you take my heart You gotta buy me, a $2 taco We got married the next year Drank some wine, and drank some beer Hitched on down in Tijuana Called my daughter Frances Farmer Just like that we are together Peas in a pod, like cheese and cheddar Tequilla its hers and his Licking salt around the rim I said Hey my name is Mark But you can call me Marko Before you take my heart You gotta by me, a $2 taco Yeah, it makes my heart flow Yeah, a $2 Taco Yeah, it makes my heart flow

2.

Screaming At The Wall 01:51

Let’s go The one eye leads the blind Through dark and testing times A metamorphosis period With chaos in our times I here with a cage In search of a bird I read the thoughts of Kafka There is knowledge in his words Trust in imperfection And symmetry oh she lies Nobody leads a simple life The beauty is that you try Try Don't try to scale the wall No need to know it all Just stand your ground Keep screaming at the wall We strive against the grain Once more into the fray Just give all you have And never be afraid A lesson in my life That you all need to know You gotta face your fears Before you start to grow Keep your dignity Through hard and swollen seas People try to freak you out To satisfy their needs Trust in imperfection And symmetry oh she lies Nobody leads a simple life The beauty’s that you try You got to try Don't try to scale the wall No need to know it all Just stand your ground Keep screaming at the wall We strive against the grain Once more into the fray Just give all you have And never be afraid

3.

Gone But Not Forgotten 01:46

I heard today that Ed had died Another sent to the sky It must be getting crowded up there Life is tough, it isn’t fair Gone, not forgotten Gone, not forgotten Gone, not forgotten Rollo, Terry, Mark and Sean A longer list we have to mourn The good die young or so they say You know we wanted you to stay Gone, not forgotten Gone, not forgotten Gone, not forgotten Life is short and you never know When it’ll be our time to go Remember us all when we’re gone Through your memories we live on Gone, not forgotten… We will not forget you…

4.

No Shoes, 2 Mobile Phones Out on the town tonight, everything is shining bright Just want to have some fun, don’t want to hurt anyone Then along the way, I heard you say “Lets Party On” And that is when, our shit it all went all wrong Erin it’s 2 am, you’re all alone You’ve got no shoes on, two mobile phones You’re in a state and it’s getting late And young love here, she sends her hate You used her credit up, and now her Uber rate is fucked Because of Erin’s lies, Bec didn’t taste halloumi fries You took your best friend’s phone, and that’s a cold hard fact We found her all alone, and that is a cunty act, cunty act Erin it’s 2 am, you’re all alone You’ve got no shoes on, two mobile phones You’re in a state and it’s getting late And young love here, she sends her hate

5.

One Minute Love Song 01:01

One Minute Love Song I’ve got one minute to say I love you You’re always on my mind You’re my partner in crime I’ve got one minute to say I love you I see you everywhere I try hard not to stare When I met you, my heart just knew I slow walk past you all the time I’ve got one minute to say I love you I’m standing in the rain I’ll never be the same I’ve got one minute to say I love you To tell you how I feel You’re honestly ideal When I met you, my heart just knew I slow walk past you all the time I’ve got one minute to say I love you…

6.

Serenity Now 01:31

Get me out of this rat race I need to quickly get off my face I need a time, I need a place Where I can find my special space I feel like prey that’s being hunted I need to be 7/8ths munted I need a guru to help guide me To my place of serenity I need to find, some peace in my mind I’m on a spiritual journey, to my serenity I need a congregation For cardinal relations To help me find Nirvana It’s my serenity I read all of the Dali lama I hung around with vegan farmers I hugged a goat and kissed a lama For my serenity I needed to look through a fresh lens I started with a colon cleanse The shit that came out my back end It gave me clarity I need to find, some peace in my mind I’m on a spiritual journey, to my serenity I need a congregation For cardinal relations To help me find Nirvana It’s my serenity It’s my serenity It’s all up to me It’s my serenity

7.

Constant Motion 02:17

Did I disappoint you enough? Well I tried And does it disappoint you to hear “I’m gonna be alright” I was not equipped for your sharpened wit Because you cut me like a knife There were nights I waited for your call I had to cut you out of my life On, I’m moving on I feel myself drawn to the ocean On, I’m moving on A lifetime of this constant motion Did you forget to tell me, or just chose to lie? And as the days turned into months Time just goes by And my heart grew cold at the lies you told Cause you know it wasn’t right And I won’t forget, when I needed you most But you were busy with another guy On, I’m moving on I feel myself drawn to the ocean On, I‘m moving on A lifetime of this constant motion On, I’m moving on A million thoughts in my head endlessly You should have chose your words less hurtfully On, I’m moving on I feel myself drawn to the ocean On, I’m moving on A lifetime of this constant motion On, I’m moving on A million thought in my head endlessly You should have chose your words less hurtfully I wish you chose your words less hurtfully

8.

Lockdown 00:37

Ahhh Lockdown Ahhh Lockdown Low brow boy, he came to party But no one fucks with Marty Little shit couldn’t take a trick So he come back with a stick Ahhh Lockdown Ahhh Lockdown When Marty activates She sealed that fuckers fate Here comes the boys in blue You don’t fuck with an A02 Ahhh Lockdown Ahhh Lockdown

9.

Land Speed Record 01:29

Go! I hold the land speed record in punk rock history I saw the Minnesota Tripletes sometime ‘round ‘93 Land speed record Land speed record I hold the land speed record; I see the rise and fall I saw the Dead Kennedys play at Festival Hall Land speed record Land speed record We hear your snipy comments, how you don’t like our band You don’t think we’ve paid our dues, given a golden hand We’ve been here since it started, for over forty years So go fuck your envy and go wipe your tears Land Speed Record

10.

Straight To Hell 01:49

I think I just met Jackie Chan Or it maybe it’s the amphetamines Late night parties, rock and roll So, I better up the Mersyndol I‘ve got a self-destructive nature I don’t handle too well So, I’ve bought a first class ticket Straight…..straight to hell I’m going straight, straight to hell Woke up on the floor again I need to see my special friend I saw his bag and reached inside And at that time, I lost my mind I‘ve got a self-destructive nature I don’t handle too well So, I’ve bought a first class ticket Straight…..straight to hell I’m going straight, straight to hell

11.

Fortitude Valley 01:49

Drinking beer again, I’m talking shit with Ken It’s another Saturday night, my future’s looking bright Walking through The Valley, it’s Saturday night I’m drinking with my friends, I’m feeling alright One more bar, one more drink One more drink, let’s not think Where the hell will we end up tonight? One more bar, one more drink One more drink, let’s not think Where the hell will we end up tonight? Drinking vodka when, we see that band again Punk rock is the way, it gets us through the day I’m walking through The Valley, it’s Saturday night I’m drinking with my friends, I’m feeling alright One more bar, one more drink One more drink, let’s not think Where the hell will we end up tonight? One more bar, one more drink One more drink, let’s not think Where the hell will we end up tonight? Whisky shots again, waiting for my friend Stranded on Winn St, who we gonna meet? Walking through The Valley it’s Saturday night I’m drinking with my friends, I’m feeling alright One more bar, one more drink One more drink, lets not think Where the hell will we end up tonight? One more Bar, one more drink One more drink, lets not think Where the hell will we end up tonight

12.

The cycle of life Cuts us down to size As I watch you fight this fucking pain inside I have no more words Is that what you deserve? But the fuck you give is my last lesson learned It’s okay to go You told me all I need to know To be the best I can And all through my life I’ve always had you by my side in everything I’ve done You made me be someone We all say goodbye Throughout our lives And I understand it’s now your time to go You’re memory, it will stay with me And those that leave us they are closer than you know It’s okay to go You told me all I need to know To be the best I can And all through my life I’ve always had you by my side in everything I’ve done You made me be someone You made me be someone It’s okay to go You told me all I need to know To be the best I can And all through my life I’ve always had you by my side in everything I’ve done You made me be someone You made me be someone

13.

Tony was a friend of mine, and he looked after me He used to live in the western ‘burbs in the late 1980’s Tony wanted to be known, he wanted to be seen We grew up strong, he grew up hard When times were tough and lean Tony was a friend of mine, he did favours for free He ruled the streets with an iron fist, he showed no mercy One night he got taken out, he lost his liberties He never did what he was told, you gotta know your enemies Me and tony had not much, but we were young you see In western Brisbane times were hard, you got nothing for free Tony was a daunting man, 6 foot 3 I still remember telling him, you’ve got to know your enemies Tony was a friend of mine, and he looked after me He ruled the streets with an iron fist, he showed no mercy One night he got taken out, he lost his liberties He never did what he was told, you gotta know your enemies

14.

In My Eye 01:28

Stand up all you fucking liars We’ll light you up like a funeral pyre You’re an afterthought, you’re a bitter taste An ugly scar I wear on my face I for one don’t value you You’re a shitty town I once drove through Something borrowed, something new I’m so better off without you It’s in my eye, it’s in my eye An everlasting memory It helps me never forget, it gives me clarity It’s in my eye, it’s in my eye A painful reminder You’ve gone away, and I’m left behind ya Sad songs they trigger me I don’t care if you’re not lonely Disappear, without a trace Hope I never see your face Finally, it’s come to me I kind of had an epiphany Why waste time on someone who Never gave the time for you It’s in my eye, it’s in my eye An everlasting memory It helps me never forget, it gave me clarity It’s in my eye, it’s in my eye A painful reminder When you went away, and I’m here behind ya

15.

I'm Moving On 01:12

What am I gonna do? When I can’t see you Where am I gonna go? How am I gonna know? What am I gonna do? When I’m without you I’ll carry On I’m moving on Here I am again Hanging with my friends Watching bands play Music is the way Out every night I’m drinking till its light I’ll carry On I’m moving on Life’s pretty good And I think you should Make the most of it Don’t take any shit Life’s what you make it Use both hands and take it I’ll carry On I’m moving on I’ll carry On I’m moving on

16.

I don’t know what I want I don’t know what I need This constant state of restlessness It’s like a fucking disease I just want to be alone, excuse me Away from those I’ve know, that use me I won’t apologise, cause you know that I was right So here I say “farewell, good riddance and goodnight” Farewell Good riddance And goodnight

17.

Yippy-Yi-Ya Motherfucker 01:08
